name: linuron
source: Hughes LD; Palmer DS; Nigsch F and Mitchell JBO. 2008 Why are some properties more difficult to predict than others? A study of QSPR models of solubility; melting point and LogP. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2008. 48 (1). pp 220?460
Reason: The melting point of linuron, a pesticide, can be estimated by comparing it to a similar compound, chlorothalonil, which has a melting point of 104.5°C. The structural differences between linuron and chlorothalonil are: (1) The presence of a urea group (NC(=O)N(C)OC) in linuron, which can increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding approximately +20°C; (2) The absence of a benzene ring in linuron, which can decrease the melting point due to the loss of aromatic interactions, reducing it by approximately -10°C. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
